benchmark_details.name: AGMMU (Agricultural Multimodal Understanding Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: AGMMU is a challenging real-world benchmark for evaluating and advancing vision-language models (VLMs) in the knowledge-intensive domain of agriculture, constructed from authentic dialogues between users and agricultural experts.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the capabilities of vision-language models in handling knowledge-intensive agricultural scenarios and improve their performance on related tasks.

data.source: Constructed from 116,231 real-world dialogues between growers and USDA-authorized experts.
data.annotation: Automated knowledge extraction followed by human verification.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the evaluation of VLMs' performance on provided questions.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy and F1 scores indicate better performance in VLM understanding and knowledge integration.
methodology.validation: Evaluation of 12 leading VLMs to benchmark their performance.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: All personal identifying information from users and experts was removed during data curation.
